concept.title: Application of LISP expressions
concept.shortdesc: LISP has its particular functions and syntax. LISP codes are capable of tested directly without preparing extra procedure. Two syntaxes are provided in LISP. The first one puts the operator in front of the operating number, in which operators can be taken as functions with specific features, and the operating number is processed by functions. Each statement is separated by a blank.

conbody.p: The second syntaxdivides the statement into two items within each bracket: function name as the first item and the parameters or variables of the function is the seconditem.
